div.p: A DECLARATION UNTO ALL, BOTH PRIESTS AND PEOPLE.

list.item: Firſt, To the Prieſts, that they may read themſelves, and ſee their ſhame.
Secondly, That people may know their Bondage, and to whom they are in bondage to.

q.p: A wonderful and horrible thing is committed in the Land; the Prophets propheſy falſly, and the Prieſts bear rule by their means, and my people love to have it ſo: and what will ye do in the end thereof?
For the ſins of her Prophets, and the iniquities of her Prieſts that have ſhed the blood of the juſt in the midſt of her,
They have wandered as blind men in the ſtreets, they have polluted themſelves with blood, ſo that men could not touch their garments.

div.p:
By one William Stymſon who is ſcornfully called a
• uaker.
LONDON, Printed for Giles Calvert at the Black-Spread-Eagle at the Weſt-end of Pauls, 1655.

div.head: A Declaration unto all, both Prieſts and People.
div.p:
ONe thing lies in my ſpirit which is a great burden unto me; therefore I cannot but ſpeak a word or two more unto you my fellow-creatures. O you poor people of England, my ſoul is ſore troubled for you, becauſe you are made ſlaves and bondmen to the wiſdom of the fleſh! My heart within me is broken, becauſe of the Prophets, that hath ſcattered my flock, and hath not viſited them ſaith the Lord,
Jer. 23.2.9. Jer. 23.2, 9. They ſpeak a viſion of their own hearts, not from the mouth of the Lord. v. 16. They ſay ſtill to him that deſpiſeth me, the Lord hath ſaid ye ſhall have peace: and to him that walketh after the imaginations of his own heart, no evil ſhall come upon you, ver. 17. The Prophets are the Task-maſters of Egypt, and are ſervants to the King of Egypt, who is King of darkneſs, they lay heavy burdens upon you, they make you make brick, and gather the ſtraw your ſelves. Exod. 5.6, 7. Exod. 5.6, 7. They lay heavy burdens upon mens ſhoulders that are grievous to be borne, and will not help with one of their ſingers: they cry out againſt men if they will not hear them preach, then they are fallen away from God, and from grace, are men of errors, charging the people they ſhould have no ſociety, or communion with any of thoſe that cannot ſubmit to their humane teachings; they lay heavy burthens upon their own hearers, telling them they muſt be much in prayer, and much in hearing the publick means, though they know not what true praying, and what true teaching is: they bid you be much in faſting, hearing, and weeping; and if you do ſo, there is no doubt but you ſhall be ſaved; here they make you make brick, and to gather the ſtraw your ſelves.

O you poor ſons and daughters of Adam, the Lord hath ſeen and heard your affliction! Hoſea 2.14. He is come to deliver you out of this Egyptian bondage, and to bring you into the
wilderneſs, and there you ſhall ſerve him; for he hath prepared for you ſome Moſes's, that ſhall go before you, and lead you into Canaan, your land of reſt and peace; For now I will ariſe, ſaith the Lord, and ſtand up to deliver my people; therefore wo unto the Paſtors that deſtroy and ſcatter my flock,
Jer. 23.1, 2. and have not viſited them; therefore I will viſite upon you the evil of your doings. Je. 23.1, 2. Wo unto you Scriles and Phariſees, hypocrites, for you ſhut up the Kingdom of Heaven againſt men: for ye neither go in your ſelves, neither ſuffer ye them that are entred, to go in. Wo to you blind guides, ye pay Tith-Mint, and Annice, and Cummin, and have neglected the weighty matters of the Law, which is Righteouſneſs, Mercy, and Judgment; Therefore wo unto you falſe Prophets ſaith the Lord, for I have ſeen folly in the Prophets of Samaria, they propheſied in Baal, they cauſed my people to err by their lyes, and by their lightneſs; for they are weighed in the ballance of God, and are found too light. The Prieſts preach for hire, and the Prophets divine for money; yet will they lean upon the Lord, and ſay, Is not the Lord among us? no evil can come upon us. Math. 23, Matth. 23. Micah 3.11. Zeph. 3.3, 4. Mich. 3.11. Zeph. 3.3, 4. Therefore, wo unto you blind guides, for the fierce anger of the Lord is gone forth in fury againſt you: a grievous whirle-winde it ſhall fall grieviouſly upon the head of the wicked: the anger of the Lord ſhall not return until he hath executed Judgment, until he hath performed the thoughts of his heart. Now in theſe latter days ye ſhall conſider this perfectly, I have not ſent theſe Prophets, yet they run: and I have not ſpoken unto them, and yet they propheſie; Behold I am againſt the Prophets ſaith the Lord, that ſteal my word, every one from his neighbour, Behold I am againſt the Prophets that uſe their tongues and ſay, thus ſaith the Lord.

You have ſtollen theſe words from your neighbour, and ſo ſpeak from hear-ſay, and not from the mouth of the Lord, What is the chaff to the wheat? ſaith the Lord, other
men have labored in preaching, and writing & you are entred into their labors: or elſe what do you do with your ſtudies full of old books of other mens writings? reading them, ſpending your time in laſineſs; for you muſt have a whole week to ſtudy 2 Sermons out of other mens works adding ſomthing of your own to it, making the people believe it is the word of God, when indeed it is but the wiſdom of the fleſh. Here you make the people ſpend their mony for that which is not bread, and their labour for that which ſatisfieth not, Iſa. 55.2. Iſa. 55.2. You will not preach without they give you ſo much money by the year, here they ſpend their money. Secondly, You feed them with husks, without the kernel, and they cannot be ſatisfied with your husks; for what is the chaff to the wheat ſaith the Lord? if they had ſtood in my Counſel, and had cauſed my people to hear my Word, then they ſhould have turned them from their evil ways, and from their evil doings. Jer. 23. Jer. 23. Therefore thus ſaith the Lord, her Prieſts in the midst thereof are like Wolves ravening the prey to ſhed blood, to deſtroy ſouls, to get diſhoneſt gain, her prophets have dawbed them with untempered morter, ſeeing vanity, and deviſing unto them, ſaying, thus ſaith the Lord God, when the Lord hath not ſpoken to them, yet they ſay, the Lord ſaith, Ezek. 22.27, 28. Ezekiel 22.27.86. 2 Theſ. 1.7. Zach. 13 2. Behold the Lord cometh in flaming fire, to render vengeance to all his enemies, to burn up all the falſe Prophets and unclean ſpirits, 2 Theſ. 1.8. Zach. 13.2. For thus ſaith the Lord, My watchmen are blind, they are all ignorant, they are greedy dogs, which can never have enough, and they are ſhepherds that cannot underſtand: they all look to their own way, eveone for his gain from his quarter: they ſtand praying in the Synagogue, and are called of men, Maſter; Matth. 11.27. therefore Chriſt cries, Wo againſt them. Math. 23.

Secondly, They deny immediat Revelation from Heaven which I and all the Saints have, and do witneſs; therefore
they deny the Father and the ſon; For no man knoweth the Father but the Son,
Mat. 11.27. and he to whomſoever the Son will reveal him. Math. 11.27.

Thirdly, They deny the Scripture: for the Scriptures declare, that all the holy men of God in all ages, the Lord made known himſelf to them, by Revelation. Here yee make God mutable and changeable, Mal. 3.6. Heb. 13.6. which is blaſphemy; for ſaith he, I am God and change not, and this we witneſs, Mal. 3.6. for He is the ſame to day, yeſterday, and for ever. Heb. 13.8.

Fourthly, They deny perfection to be obtained while creatures live in this body of clay: here alſo ye deny the Scripture, which holds out perfection, to be obtained while the creature lives, or never. Gen. 17.1. Matth. 5.48. 1 Pet. 5.10.

list.item: Firſt, Ye deny God, Deut. 32.4. Matth. 5.48. who is perfect in himſelf, and all the Saints are made perfect as they are gathered up into Him. Gen. 17.1. Deut. 18.13. Eph. 4.11, 12, 13. Heb. 6.1.

Secondly, They deny the enjoyment and life of the Saints and holy men of God, which they were come to, and lived in, and did witneſs the ſame to all the world, Gen. 6.9. Pſalms 37.38. 1 Cor. 2.6. Phil. 3.15. here they are lyars and deceivers, and keep poor people in their ſins and filthineſs; for they tell them they ſhall never be perfect while they live in this body of clay, and ſo people go on in pride, covetouſneſs and oppreſſion, envy, malice, and bitter cruelty, and contention, lying, ſwearing drunkenneſs, luſt and uncleanneſs, with all kind of wickedneſs, ſo that none returns from his evil doings; Therefore
wo, wo unto them, for they go in the way of Cain, and are in the error of Balaam, who love the wages of unrighteouſneſs, and ſo deny Chriſt who was perfect, and the Apoſtle who ſaid, as he is, ſo sre we in this world; for he was perfect, and ſo muſt we be: and he that hath this hope in him, purifieth himſelf even as he is pure, 1 John 4.17. chap. 3.3. chap. 2.6. There is a voice of the howling of the Shepherds; for their glory is ſpoiled: a voice of the roaring of young Lyons; for the pride of Jordan is ſpoiled. Zech. 11.3. This is the word of the Lord, Wo to the Crown of pride, to the drunkards of Ephraim, whoſe glorious beauty is a fading flower, Iſaiah 28.1. The Pride of Iſrael doth teſtifie to his face therefore ſhall Iſrael and Ephraim fall in their iniquity: Judah alſo ſhall fall with them: they ſhall go with their flocks, and with their heards to ſeek the Lord, but they ſhall not find Him, He hath withdrawn himſelf from them. Hoſ. 5.5, 6. Therefore my Counſel is, that you would leave off deceiving poor ſouls, and let the Lord who is an everlaſting teacher, teach them; Pſa. 23. Iſa. 40.11. for He will lead them in the paths of Righteouſneſs, for Pſalm 23. He will lead his flock like a ſhepheard, and carry his Lambs in his Arms, and carry them in his boſome, and gently lead them that are with young. Iſa. 40.11. But as for you he will ſpew you out of his mouth, and ye ſhall be as unſavory ſalt under the foot of men: Jer. 28.26. becauſe ye have taught rebellion againſt the Lord, Jer. 28.26. And I will gather my People from all places whither ye have driven them, and will ſet ſhepheards over them, which ſhall not be lacking, ſaith the Lord, Ier. 3.15. for I will give them Paſtors according to my own heart, ſaith the Lord, Jer. 3.15. they ſhall build up the old waſte places, they ſhall raiſe up the former deſolations, that you and your fathers the Prieſts have made; for they ſhall be called the Prieſts of the Lord,
Iſa. 61.4.5. and men ſhall call them the Miniſters of our God. Iſa. 61.4.6. They ſhall bring all your brethren for an offering unto the Lord,
out of all Nations upon Horſes, and Chariots, and Litters, and upon Mules, and upon ſwift beaſts to my holy Mountain Jeruſalem, ſaith the Lord; as the Children of Iſrael bring an offering in clean veſſels unto the Houſe of the Lord, I will alſo take of them for Prieſts, and for Levites ſaith the Lord; for New Heavens, and New Earth, which I make, ſhall remain before me, ſaith the Lord: ſo ſhall your ſeed, and your names remain from one new Moon to another: and from one Sabbath to another, ſhall all fleſh come, and worſhip before me ſaith the Lord. Iſa. 66.20, 21, 22, 23. verſes.
